abstract.p: List of paperback books about or set in Australia (S)

block.p: From walkabouts to histories, there are plenty of books for armchair travelers seeking a literary glimpse of life down under. Among the titles currently in paperback are the following:
The Fatal Shore, by Robert Hughes (1987). A history of Australia's early years as a British penal colony. (Vintage, $17.)
Eucalyptus, by Murray Bail (1998). Magical fiction about a homesteader in the outback. (Harvest/Harcourt Brace, $13.)
The Birth of Sydney, edited by Tim Flannery (1999). A history told through the accounts of explorers, settlers and journalists. (Grove, $14.).
Illywhacker, by Peter Carey (1985). A big, bawdy novel about Aussie life as seen through the eyes of an aged con man. (Vintage International, $15.)
1988, by Andrew McGahan (1997). A darkly funny novel about a slacker road trip into the Northern Territory. (St. Martin's Griffin, $12.95.)
The Songlines, by Bruce Chatwin (1987). A highly personal journey into the Aborigines' culture. (Penguin, $13.95.)
Tracks: A Woman's Solo Trek Across 1,700 Miles of Australian Outback, by Robyn Davidson (1981). Across the continent with four camels and a dog. (Vintage Departures, $12.)

The Songlines, by Bruce Chatwin (1987). A highly personal journey into the Aborigines' culture. (Penguin, $13.95.)
